intro: Asteranthemum vulgare, commonly known as the common asteranthemum, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its showy flowers, which range from white to purple, bloom in late summer and early autumn. Asteranthemum vulgare is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
